newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romanian OTC market turnover on the rise.
newsitem.headline: Romanian OTC market turnover on the rise.

text.p: Romania's over-the-counter (OTC) market turnover rose to an all-time high of 29.7 billion lei this week against 27 billion lei in the previous week.
Around 8.9 million shares changed hands this week on the RASDAQ -- an OTC system modelled on the U.S. NASDAQ exchange-- up from 6.6 million last week.
"Investors interest focused on cement makers, especially on Romcim," one trader said.
Romcim SA took the bulk of the this week's turnover. It closed at 40,000 lei on Friday, gaining 11,000 lei on the week.

Traders said they expected turnover to pick up further, with Romcim staying in the limelight, but said share prices would continue to track sideways amid volatility caused by failure of some companies listed on RASDAQ to release full financial results.
The unofficial VAB-RASDAQ index, computed by Vanguard SA, rose by 4.8 percent on the week to 1,511.9 points.
The RASDAQ, which opened last October, lists 2,332 companies. It traded an average 242 companies this week. ($=6,822 lei)
